title: Lewis structures - least soluble in water

content.question: Which of the following molecules is least soluble in water?

choices.label: The molecule has two C H 3 groups. Each group is attached with a single bond to the same C atom. The C atom with the two C H 3 groups is also attached to an O atom with a double bond.  The O atom has 2 pairs of nonbonding electrons.
The molecule has 4 C L atoms each attached with a single bond to the same C atom. Each C L atom has 3 pairs of nonbonding electrons.
The molecule has a C H 3 group attached with a single bond to an O atom which is single-bonded to an H atom. The O atom has 2 pairs of nonbonding electrons.
The molecule has two C H 3 groups. Each C H 3 group is attached with a single bond to the same O atom. The O atom has 2 pairs of nonbonding electrons.

content.answer: The molecule has 4 C L atoms each attached with a single bond to the same C atom. Each C L atom has 3 pairs of nonbonding electrons.

skill.text: 4.C: Explain the connection between particulate-level and macroscopic properties of a substance using models and representations.
